text: was a Japanese art director. He was born in Tokyo. He developed a skill in drawing, and became among the most prominent set designers in Japanese cinema following World War II.Takashi Sasayama, J. R. Mulryne, Margaret Shewring, Shakespeare and the Japanese Stage, Cambridge University Press, 1998, p. 54, . He won the Mainichi Film Award for Best Art Direction for the 1953 film Ugetsu. In 1955, he served as art director for She Was Like a Wild Chrysanthemum.Jacek Klinowski, Adam Garbicz, Jacek Klinowski & Adam Garbicz, Feature Cinema in the 20th Century: Volume Two: 1951-1963: A Comprehensive Guide, Planet RGB Limited, 2012, . ==References== Category:1899 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Japanese art directors Category:People from Tokyo Category:Japanese centenarians
